alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 2:25AM MDT until June 22 at 3:30AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern El Paso County in east central Colorado... * Until 330 AM MDT. * At 225 AM MDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding continues in Fountain and Security Areas. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Several roads are closed due to flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southern Colorado Springs, Fountain, Hanover, Security-Widefield, Security, and Fort Carson. This includes the following streams and drainages... Jimmy Camp Creek, Williams Creek, Little Fountain Creek, Turkey Creek, Sand Creek, Cheyenne Creek, Chico Creek, Fountain Creek, Black Squirrel Creek, Pond Creek, Rock Creek, Red Creek, East Fork Red Creek, Little Turkey Creek, South Cheyenne Creek and Burnt Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
